intro: Egania racemosa, commonly known as the racemose egonia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Egania racemosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
